Tolkien wrote that the later Ages lasted about 3
column3: though this duration was not fixed and he felt that the Ages 'sped up' over time. Each ended following the completion of some major event in the history of the Children of Ilúvatar.

column1: In some texts Tolkien referred to the 'First Age of Middle-earth' or the 'First Age of the World' rather than the 'First Age of the Children of Ilúvatar'. These variations had earlier starting points
column2: extending the First Age back to the creation of Arda
column3: but consistently ended with [[Morgoth]]'s defeat in [[Beleriand]].

column1: The terms 'First Age of the Sun' and 'Ages of the Sun' are commonly used by many fans
column2: but do not appear anywhere in Tolkien's writings. The 'First Age of the Sun' in this conception is held to begin with the first rising of the Sun and continue until Morgoth's defeat nearly 600 years later. While this is at odds with Tolkien's statements that the first age was the longest by far it is a common misapprehension because the subsequent ages all took place entirely during the [[Years of the Sun]].
